comments.body: This seems slightly worse; if we see a semi-colon in these contexts, we really should be assuming they meant a comma and gracefully continue (and assume they meant whatever we were able to parse - that means this would be a shorthand property).
The similar argument can be made for normal property assignment too. The main reason I change this is that trying to parse this as normal short-hand so we don't report missing identifier as well.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +6,10 @@    var tt = { aa; }
                 ~
!!! error TS1005: ':' expected.
                   ~
!!! error TS1128: Declaration or statement expected.
